6 . The genome of SARS-CoV-2 is about 30 kb, in which open reading frames (ORF) 1a and 1 b encode two polyproteins (pps), pp1a and pp1ab
2 . To complete the lifecycle of SARS-CoV-2, successful proteolytic processing of pp1a and pp1ab is required to yield a total of 16 non-structural proteins (nsp1–16)
2 . The consensus functions of these virus-encoded proteolytic proteins are found in all β CoVs, specifically papain-like protease (PLpro) and chymotrypsin-like protease (3CLpro)
2 . In particular, the substrate binding site of SARS-CoV-2 3CLpro is highly conserved across the β CoVs suggesting the therapeutic potential of 3CLpro inhibitors for SARS-CoV-2 and other β CoVs
